planets.name: mercury
planets.alt: The surface of Mercury in front of the Sun as viewed by MESSENGER.

planets.name: venus
planets.alt: This image was processed from archived Mariner 10 data by JPL engineer Kevin M. Gill.

planets.name: earth
planets.alt: The Blue Marble is a famous photograph of the Earth taken on December 7, 1972, by the crew of the Apollo 17 spacecraft en route to the Moon at a distance of about 29,000 kilometres (18,000 mi). It shows Africa, Antarctica, and the Arabian Peninsula.

planets.name: mars
planets.alt: True color image of Mars taken by the OSIRIS instrument on the ESA Rosetta spacecraft during its February 2007 flyby of the planet.

planets.name: jupiter
planets.alt: This full-disc image of Jupiter was taken on 21 April 2014 with Hubble's Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3).

planets.name: saturn
planets.alt: This captivating natural color view of the planet Saturn was created from images collected shortly after Cassini began its extended Equinox Mission in July 2008.

planets.name: uranus
planets.alt: This is an image of the planet Uranus taken by the spacecraft Voyager 2 in 1986.

planets.name: neptune
planets.alt: Voyager 2 Narrow Angle Camera image of Neptune taken on August 20, 1989 as the spacecraft approached the planet for a flyby on August 25.
